qas.question: Who was the first important Cyprus painter of modern times?

answers.text: Academy of Fine Arts in Venice

qas.question: Name one of the individuals considered the founding fathers of modern Cypriot art.
Name the other individual considered the founding fathers of modern Cypriot art.
Where do many Cypriot artists train?

context: In modern times Cypriot art history begins with the painter <a0_0>Vassilis Vryonides<a0_0/> (1883–1958) who studied at the <a1_0>Academy of Fine Arts in Venice<a1_0/>. Arguably the two founding fathers of modern Cypriot art were <a2_0>Adamantios Diamantis<a2_0/> (1900–1994) who studied at London's Royal College of Art and <a3_0>Christopheros Savva<a3_0/> (1924–1968) who also studied in London, at Saint Martin's School of Art. In many ways these two artists set the template for subsequent Cypriot art and both their artistic styles and the patterns of their education remain influential to this day. In particular the majority of Cypriot artists still train in <a4_0>England<a4_0/> while others train at art schools in Greece and local art institutions such as the Cyprus College of Art, University of Nicosia and the Frederick Institute of Technology.
